bacru.definition: x1 utters verbally/says/phonates/speaks [vocally makes sound] x2.
bacru.notes: Also voices; does not necessarily imply communication or audience; ('says' is usually {cusku}). See also {krixa}, {cusku}, {casnu}, {tavla}, {voksa}, {pinka}.

badna.definition: x1 is a banana/plantain [fruit/plant] of species/breed x2.

badri.definition: x1 is sad/depressed/dejected/[unhappy/feels sorrow/grief] about x2 (abstraction).

bajra.definition: x1 runs on surface x2 using limbs x3 with gait x4.

bakfu.definition: x1 is a bundle/package/cluster/clump/pack [shape/form] containing x2, held together by x3.

bakni.definition: x1 is a cow/cattle/kine/ox/[bull/steer/calf] [beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed x2.

bakri.definition: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of chalk from source x2 in form x3.

baktu.definition: x1 is a bucket/pail/can/deep, solid, wide-topped container of contents x2, made of material x3.

balji.definition: x1 is a bulb [body-part] of plant/species x2; [metaphor: rounded, bulgy].

balni.definition: x1 is a balcony/overhang/ledge/shelf of building/structure x2.

balre.definition: x1 is a blade of tool/weapon x2.

balvi.definition: x1 is in the future of/later than/after x2 in time sequence; x1 is latter; x2 is former.
balvi.notes: Also sequel, succeed, successor, follow, come(s) after; time ordering only (use {lidne} otherwise); aorist in that x1 may overlap in time with x2 as long as it extends afterwards; non-aorist future (= {cfabalvi}); (default x2 is the space time reference, whereupon:) x1 will occur. See also {lidne}, {cabna}, {purci}, {farna}.

bancu.definition: x1 exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary x2 from x3 in property/amount x4 (ka/ni).
bancu.notes: On the other side of a bound, but not necessarily directly 'across' nor at the shortest plausible distance (per {ragve}); also not limited to position in space. See also {dukse}, {ragve}, {zmadu}, {kuspe}.

bandu.definition: x1 (event) defends/protects x2 (object/state) from threat/peril/potential x3 (event).
bandu.notes: Also secures (verb); x1 wards/resists x3; protective cover/shield (= {badgai}). See also {ckape}, {fanta}, {fapro}, {marbi}, {rivbi}, {zunti}, {snura}, {binra}, {lunbe}, {pulji}.

banfi.definition: x1 is an amphibian of species/breed x2.

bangu.definition: x1 is a/the language/dialect used by x2 to express/communicate x3 (si'o/du'u, not quote).

banli.definition: x1 is great/grand in property x2 (ka) by standard x3.
banli.notes: Indicates a subjective greatness, as compared to the objective standard implied for {barda}; (synonyms, possibly requiring tanru:) extraordinary, illustrious, magnificent, impressive, awesome, grandiose, august, inspiring, special, majestic, distinguished, eminent, splendor, stately, imposing (all generally {zabna}); terrible ({mabla}). See also {barda}, {nobli}, {se} {sinma}, {pluja}, {misno}, {vajni}, {fasnu}, {cizra}, {traji}, {mutce}, {se} {manci}.

banro.definition: x1 grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form x2 from x3.
banro.notes: Also rising, developing; x1 gets bigger/enlarges/increases. See also {farvi}, {zenba}, {jmina}, {barda}, {makcu}, {ferti}.

banxa.definition: x1 is a bank owned by/in banking system x2 for banking function(s) x3 (event).

banzu.definition: x1 (object) suffices/is enough/sufficient for purpose x2 under conditions x3.

bapli.definition: x1 [force] (ka) forces/compels event x2 to occur; x1 determines property x2 to manifest.
bapli.notes: Also constrains; requires success, unlike the physics term (better expressed by {danre}). See also {fanta}, {rinju}, {jimte}, {jitro}, {rinka}, {krinu}, {zukte}, {randa}, {danre}, cmavo list {bai}, {marxa}, {tinsa}, {xarnu}.

barda.definition: x1 is big/large in property/dimension(s) x2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x3.

bargu.definition: x1 arches/curves over/around x2 and is made of x3; x1 is an arch over/around x2 of material x3.
bargu.notes: Also arc; x2 need not be an object, but may be a point or volume. See also {cripu}, {kruvi}, {korcu}, {condi}.

barja.definition: x1 is a tavern/bar/pub serving x2 to audience/patrons x3.

barna.definition: x1(s) is a/are mark(s)/spot(s) on x2 of material x3.
barna.notes: {ba'armo'a} for a pattern of marks. See also {sinxa}, {pixra}, {se} {ciska}, {se} {prina}.

bartu.definition: x1 is on the outside of x2; x1 is exterior to x2.

basna.definition: x1 emphasizes/accentuates/gives emphasis/stress/accent to x2 by (action) x3.

basti.definition: x1 replaces/substitutes for/instead of x2 in circumstance x3; x1 is a replacement/substitute.
basti.notes: Also: x1 trades places with x2. See also cmavo list {ba'i}, {binra}.

batci.definition: x1 bites/pinches x2 on/at specific locus x3 with x4.

batke.definition: x1 is a button/knob/[handle] on/for item x2, with purpose x3, made of material x4.

bavmi.definition: x1 is a quantity of barley [grain] of species/strain x2.

baxso.definition: x1 reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect x2.

bebna.definition: x1 is foolish/silly in event/action/property [folly] (ka) x2; x1 is a boob.

bemro.definition: x1 reflects North American culture/nationality/geography in aspect x2.

bende.definition: x1 is a crew/team/gang/squad/band of persons x2 directed/led by x3 organized for purpose x4.
bende.notes: (x1 is a mass; x2 is a set completely specified); Also orchestra (= {zgibe'e}, {balzgibe'e}), outfit; x3 conductor; business, not necessarily incorporated (= {cajbe'e}, {venbe'e}). See also {gunma}, {girzu}, {dansu}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {kagni}, {kamni}, {minde}, {ralju}, {cecmu}, {gidva}.

bengo.definition: x1 reflects Bengali/Bangladesh culture/nationality/language in aspect x2.

benji.definition: x1 transfers/sends/transmits x2 to receiver x3 from transmitter/origin x4 via means/medium x5.
benji.notes: Also possibly "sharing"; no (complete) alienation from origin is implied. x5 carrier. See also {muvdu}, {dunda}, {mrilu}, {nirna}, {xruti}, {cradi}, {tivni}, {preja}, cmavo list {be'i}, {bevri}, {mrilu}, {tcana}.

bersa.definition: x1 is a son of mother/father/parents x2 [not necessarily biological].

berti.definition: x1 is to the north/northern side [right-hand-rule pole] of x2 according to frame of reference x3.

besna.definition: x1 is a/the brain [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: intelligence, mental control].

betfu.definition: x1 is a/the abdomen/belly/lower trunk [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: midsection].
betfu.notes: Also stomach (= {djaruntyrango}), digestive tract (= {befctirango}, {befctirangyci'e}). See also {cutne}, {livga}, {canti}.

betri.definition: x1 is a tragedy/disaster/tragic for x2.

bevri.definition: x1 carries/hauls/bears/transports cargo x2 to x3 from x4 over path x5; x1 is a carrier/[porter].
bevri.notes: Alienation from x2 to x3 is implied. See also {marce}, {muvdu}, {benji}, {klama}.

bidju.definition: x1 is a bead/pebble [shape/form] of material x2.

bifce.definition: x1 is a bee/wasp/hornet of species/breed x2.

bilga.definition: x1 is bound/obliged to/has the duty to do/be x2 in/by standard/agreement x3; x1 must do x2.
bilga.notes: Also x3 frame of reference. See also {zifre}, {fuzme}.

bilma.definition: x1 is ill/sick/diseased with symptoms x2 from disease x3.

bilni.definition: x1 is military/regimented/is strongly organized/prepared by system x2 for purpose x3.
bilni.notes: Also paramilitary; soldier in its broadest sense - not limited to those trained/organized as part of an army to defend a state (= {bilpre}). See also jenmi for a military {force}, {sonci}, {ganzu}, {pulji}.

bindo.definition: x1 reflects Indonesian culture/nationality/language in aspect x2.

binra.definition: x1 insures/indemnifies x2 (person) against peril x3 (event) providing benefit(s) x4 (event).
binra.notes: Also x3 loss; sell/purchase insurance (= {binryve'u}), premium (= {binrydi'a}, or {binryvelve'u}). See also {bandu}, {cirko}, {betri}, {basti}, {bilma}.

binxo.definition: x1 becomes/changes/converts/transforms into x2 under conditions x3.
binxo.notes: Resultative, not-necessarily causal, change. (cf. {cenba} for non-resultative, {galfi} for causal, {stika} for non-resultative, non-causal change; {zasni})

birje.definition: x1 is made of/contains/is a amount of beer/ale/brew brewed from x2.

birka.definition: x1 is a/the arm [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: branch with strength].
birka.notes: Also elbow (= {bircidni}), wrist (= {xanterjo'e}), appendage (but jimca, rebla preferred). See also {jimca}, {janco}, {xance}, {rebla}.

birti.definition: x1 is certain/sure/positive/convinced that x2 is true.

bisli.definition: x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains ice [frozen crystal] of composition/material x2.
bisli.notes: Composition including x2, which need not be a complete composition. See also {kunra}, {runme}, {lenku}, {krili}, {bratu}, {snime}, {carvi}.

bitmu.definition: x1 is a wall/fence separating x2 and x3 (unordered) of/in structure x4.

blabi.notes: Pale forms of other colors are a compound of white; e.g. pink (= {labyxu'e}, {xunblabi}) (whereas kandi is used for pale = dimness, lack of intensity). See also {skari}, {xekri}, {grusi}, {kandi}, {manku}, {carmi}, {bakri}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

blaci.definition: x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains glass of composition including x2.

bliku.definition: x1 is a block [3-dimensional shape/form] of material x2, surfaces/sides x3.
bliku.notes: x3 sides/surfaces should include number, size, and shape; also polyhedron (= {pitybli} having flat/planar sides/surfaces). regular polyhedron (= {kubybli}, {blikubli}), brick (= {kitybli}); See also {tapla}, {kubli}, {tanbo}, {canlu}, {kojna}, {sefta}, {bolci}, {kurfa}, {tarmi}.

bloti.definition: x1 is a boat/ship/vessel [vehicle] for carrying x2, propelled by x3.

bolci.definition: x1 is a ball/sphere/orb/globe [shape/form] of material x2; x1 is a spherical object [made of x2].

bongu.definition: x1 is a/the bone/ivory [body-part], performing function x2 in body of x3; [metaphor: calcium].
bongu.notes: x2 is likely an abstract: may be structure/support for some body part, but others as well such as the eardrum bones; the former can be expressed as (tu'a le <body-part>); cartilage/gristle (= {ranbo'u}), skeleton (= {bogygreku}). See also {greku}, {denci}, {jirna}, {sarji}.

botpi.definition: x1 is a bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for x2, made of material x3 with lid x4.

boxfo.definition: x1 is a sheet/foil/blanket [2-dimensional shape/form flexible in 3 dimensions] of material x2.

boxna.definition: x1 is a wave [periodic pattern] in medium x2, wave-form x3, wave-length x4, frequency x5.

bradi.definition: x1 is an enemy/opponent/adversary/foe of x2 in struggle x3.

bratu.definition: x1 is hail/sleet/freezing rain/solid precipitation of material/composition including x2.
bratu.notes: This is the substance, not the act or manner of its falling, which is carvi. See also {carvi}, {snime}, {bisli}, {tcima}.

brazo.definition: x1 reflects Brazilian culture/nationality/language in aspect x2.

bridi.definition: x1 (text) is a predicate relationship with relation x2 among arguments (sequence/set) x3.
bridi.notes: Also: x3 are related by relation x2 (= {terbri} for reordered places). (x3 is a set completely specified); See also {sumti}, {fancu}.

brife.definition: x1 is a breeze/wind/gale from direction x2 with speed x3; x1 blows from x2.

briju.definition: x1 is an office/bureau/work-place of worker x2 at location x3.

brito.definition: x1 reflects British/United Kingdom culture/nationality in aspect x2.

broda.definition: 1st assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).

brode.definition: 2nd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).

brodi.definition: 3rd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).

brodo.definition: 4th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).

brodu.definition: 5th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).

bruna.definition: x1 is brother of/fraternal to x2 by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) x3; [not necess. biological].

budjo.definition: x1 pertains to the Buddhist culture/religion/ethos in aspect x2.

bukpu.definition: x1 is an amount of cloth/fabric of type/material x2.

bumru.definition: x1 is foggy/misty/covered by a fog/mist/vapor of liquid x2.

bunda.definition: x1 is x2 (def. 1) local weight unit(s) [non-metric], standard x3, subunits [e.g. ounces] x4.
bunda.notes: (additional subunit places may be added as x5, x6, ...); See also {grake}, {junta}, {tilju}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {kramu}.

burcu.definition: x1 is a brush for purpose x2 (event) with bristles x3.

cabna.definition: x1 is current at/in the present of/during/concurrent/simultaneous with x2 in time.
cabna.notes: (default x2 is the present resulting in:) x1 is now; time relationship only, 'aorist' claiming simultaneity does not mean one event does not extend into the past or future of the other. See also {zvati}, {balvi}, {purci}, cmavo list {ca}, cmavo list {ca'a}.

cabra.definition: x1 is apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment for function x2 controlled/[triggered] by x3 (agent).
cabra.notes: Form determined by/from function; does not imply automated/automatic action - requires an external agent/trigger (a minji may be a zmiku cabra if it requires an external agent to trigger or control the functions that it performs automatically). (cf. {tutci}, {minji}, {finti}; {girzu}, {ganzu} for organizational apparatus, pilno)

cacra.definition: x1 is x2 hours in duration (default is 1 hour) by standard x3.

cadzu.definition: x1 walks/strides/paces on surface x2 using limbs x3.

cafne.definition: x1 (event) often/frequently/commonly/customarily occurs/recurs by standard x2.
cafne.notes: See also {rirci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {rapli}, {krefu}, {lakne}, cmavo list piso'iroi and similar {compounds}.

cakla.definition: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of chocolate/cocoa.

calku.definition: x1 is a shell/husk [hard, protective covering] around x2 composed of x3.

canci.definition: x1 vanishes/disappears from location x2; x1 ceases to be observed at x2 using senses/sensor x3.
canci.notes: Also leaves, goes away (one sense). See also {cliva}, {ganse}, {zgana}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

cando.notes: "in motion", not implying a change in location, is negation of this. See also {surla}.

cange.definition: x1 is a farm/ranch at x2, farmed by x3, raising/producing x4; (adjective:) x1 is agrarian.
cange.notes: Also grange; farming is any organized agrarian activity, not limited to plant crops. See also {purdi}, {nurma}, {ferti}, {foldi}, {xarju}.

canja.definition: x1 exchanges/trades/barters commodity x2 for x3 with x4; x1, x4 is a trader/merchant/businessman.
canja.notes: Also (adjective:) x1, x2, x4 is/are commercial (better expressed as ka canja, {kamcanja}). x2/x3 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posycanja} for unambiguous semantics); (cf. {dunda}, {friti}, {vecnu}, {zarci}, {jdini}, {pleji}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {banxa}, {cirko}, {dunda}, {janta}, {kargu}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {zivle})

canko.definition: x1 is a window/portal/opening [portal] in wall/building/structure x2.

canlu.definition: x1 is space/volume/region/room [at-least-3-dimensional area] occupied by x2.

canpa.definition: x1 is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging x2.

canre.definition: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of sand/grit from source x2 of composition including x3.

canti.definition: x1 is a/the gut(s)/entrails/intestines/viscera/innards/digestive system [body-part] of x2.

carce.definition: x1 is a cart/carriage/wagon [wheeled vehicle] for carrying x2, propelled by x3.

carmi.definition: x1 is intense/bright/saturated/brilliant in property (ka) x2 as received/measured by observer x3.
carmi.notes: Also lustrous, gleaming, sparkling, shining (all probably better metaphorically combined with gusni: gusycai or camgu'i); in colors, refers principally to increased saturation (with opposite kandi). See also {denmi}, {gusni}, {kandi}, {ruble}, {skari}, {tilju}, {tsali}, {mutce}, {blabi}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

carna.definition: x1 turns/rotates/revolves around axis x2 in direction x3.

cartu.definition: x1 is a chart/diagram/map of/about x2 showing formation/data-points x3.

carvi.definition: x1 rains/showers/[precipitates] to x2 from x3; x1 is precipitation [not limited to 'rain'].

casnu.definition: x1(s) (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject x2.

catke.definition: x1 [agent] shoves/pushes x2 at locus x3.
catke.notes: Move by pushing/shoving (= {ca'ermuvgau}). (cf. danre for non-agentive force, lacpu)

catlu.notes: Also look through (= {grecta}, {ravycta}, {bacycta}); note that English "look" often means a more generic "observe". See also {jvinu}, {minra}, {simlu}, {viska}, {lanli}, {zgana}, {setca}, {viska}.

catni.definition: x1 has authority/is an official in/on/over matter/sphere/persons x2 derived on basis x3.

catra.definition: x1 (agent) kills/slaughters/murders x2 by action/method x3.

caxno.definition: x1 is shallow in extent in direction/property x2 away from reference point x3 by standard x4.

cecla.definition: x1 launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile x2, propelled by x3 [propellant/propulsion].
cecla.notes: Also: x1 is a gun/launcher/cannon; x1 hurls/throws/casts (more general than renro in that propulsion need not be internal to x1). See also {renro}, {danti}, {jakne}, {jbama}, {spoja}.

cecmu.definition: x1 is a community/colony of organisms x2.

cedra.definition: x1 is an era/epoch/age characterized by x2 (event/property/interval/idea).
cedra.notes: (x2 interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; x2 may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); See also {ranji}, {temci}, {citsi}.

cenba.definition: x1 varies/changes in property/quantity x2 (ka/ni) in amount/degree x3 under conditions x4.
cenba.notes: Non-resultative, not-necessarily causal change. (cf. cenba which is non-resultative, galfi which is resultative and causal, stika which is non-resultative and causal; stodi, zasni, binxo)

censa.definition: x1 is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group x2.

centi.definition: x1 is a hundredth [1/100; $1*10^{-2}$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

cerda.definition: x1 is an heir to/is to inherit x2 (object/quality) from x3 according to rule x4.
cerda.notes: Pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in x2) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= {posycerda}, posyselcerda for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {jgina}.

cerni.definition: x1 is a morning [dawn until after typical start-of-work for locale] of day x2 at location x3.
cerni.notes: This morning (= {cabdeicerni}); tomorrow morning (= {bavlamcerni}); yesterday morning (= {prulamcerni}, {prulamdeicerni}) See also {vanci}, {murse}, {tcika}.

certu.definition: x1 is an expert/pro/has prowess in/is skilled at x2 (event/activity) by standard x3.

cevni.definition: x1 is a/the god/deity of people(s)/religion x2 with dominion over x3 [sphere]; x1 is divine.
cevni.notes: Also divinity; x2 religion refers to the religious community as a mass. See also {censa}, {krici}, {lijda}, {malsi}.

cfika.definition: x1 is a work of fiction about plot/theme/subject x2/under convention x2 by author x3.
cfika.notes: Also story, lie, untrue. See also {cukta}, {lisri}, {prosa}, {fatci}, {jitfa}, {jetnu}, {xanri}.

cfila.definition: x1 (property - ka) is a flaw/fault/defect in x2 causing x3.

cfine.definition: x1 is a wedge [shape/form/tool] of material x2.

cfipu.definition: x1 (event/state) confuses/baffles x2 [observer] due to [confusing] property x3 (ka).

ciblu.definition: x1 is blood/vital fluid of organism x2.

cidja.definition: x1 is food/feed/nutriment for x2; x1 is edible/gives nutrition to x2.

cidni.definition: x1 is a/the knee/elbow/knuckle [hinged joint, body-part] of limb x2 of body x3.
cidni.notes: Metaphor: a sharp bend/curve. See also {korcu}, {jarco}, {jganu}.

cidro.definition: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of hydrogen (H); [metaphor: light, flammable].

cifnu.definition: x1 is an infant/baby [helpless through youth/incomplete development] of species x2.

cigla.definition: x1 is a/the gland [body-part] secreting x2, of body x3; x2 is a secretion of x1.

cikre.definition: x1 repairs/mends/fixes x2 for use x3.
cikre.notes: A repair may be incomplete, fixing only one of the possible uses of x2, hence x3. See also {cfila}, {spofu}.

ciksi.definition: x1 (person) explains x2 (event/state/property) to x3 with explanation x4 (du'u).
ciksi.notes: Explanation x4 is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for x2 (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause. See also {cipra}, {danfu}, {jalge}, {jinvi}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {nabmi}, {preti}, {rinka}, {sidbo}, {zukte}, {tavla}.

cilmo.definition: x1 is moist/wet/damp with liquid x2.

cilre.definition: x1 learns x2 (du'u) about subject x3 from source x4 (obj./event) by method x5 (event/process).

cilta.definition: x1 is a thread/filament/wire [shape/form] of material x2.

cimde.definition: x1 (property - ka) is a dimension of space/object x2 according to rules/model x3.

cimni.definition: x1 is infinite/unending/eternal in property/dimension x2, to degree x3 (quantity)/of type x3.
cimni.notes: Also everlasting, eternity, (= {cimnytei}), eternal (= cimnyteikai or {temcimni}). See also {vitno}, {renvi}, {munje}, {fanmo}, {sisti}.

cinba.definition: x1 (agent) kisses/busses x2 at locus x3.

cindu.definition: x1 is an oak, a type of tree of species/strain x2.

cinfo.definition: x1 is a lion/[lioness] of species/breed x2.

cinje.definition: x1 is a wrinkle/crease/fold [shape/form] in x2.

cinki.definition: x1 is an insect/arthropod of species x2; [bug/beetle].

cinla.definition: x1 is thin in direction/dimension x2 by standard x3; [relatively short in smallest dimension].

cinmo.definition: x1 feels emotion x2 (ka) about x3.
cinmo.notes: Also mood/humor (= {nuncni}). See also cmavo list {ci'o}, {cumla}, {jilra}, {nelci}, {xendo}, {ckeji}, {cortu}, {jgira}, {kecti}, {kufra}, {manci}, {prami}, {steba}, {zungi}, {badri}, {burna}, {gleki}.

cinri.definition: x1 (abstraction) interests/is interesting to x2; x2 is interested in x1.
cinri.notes: Use x1 tu'a for non-specific interest in an object; interested in (= {selci'i}). See also {zdile}, {kucli}, {manci}, {kurji}.

cinse.definition: x1 in activity/state x2 exhibits sexuality/gender/sexual orientation x3 (ka) by standard x4.
cinse.notes: Also: x1 courts/flirts; x3 could be a ka <gender or role>, ka <attraction to a gender>, or ka <type of activity>, etc.; (adjective:) x1 is sexual/sexy; x1 is flirted with/courted by x2 (= {cinfriti}, {cinjikca}). See also {gletu}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}.

cinta.definition: x1 [material] is a paint of pigment/active substance x2, in a base of x3.

cinza.definition: x1 is a/are tong(s)/chopsticks/pincers/tweezers/pliers [tool/body-part] for x2 to pinch x3.

cipni.definition: x1 is a bird/avian/fowl of species x2.

cipra.definition: x1 (process/event) is a test for/proof of property/state x2 in subject x3 (individ./set/mass).
cipra.notes: Also examination, proxy measure, validation; (a set in x3 must be completely specified). See also {ciksi}, {troci}, {jarco}, {pajni}, {saske}.

cirko.definition: x1 loses person/thing x2 at/near x3; x1 loses property/feature x2 in conditions/situation x3.
cirko.notes: x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (rare for cirko), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {po'ecri}, posyselcri for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {facki}, {ralte}, {sisku}, {claxu}, {jinga}, {pleji}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {binra}, {mipri}.

cirla.definition: x1 is a quantity of/contains cheese/curd from source x2.

ciska.definition: x1 inscribes/writes x2 on display/storage medium x3 with writing implement x4; x1 is a scribe.
ciska.notes: Also x3 writing surface. See also {papri}, {penbi}, {pinsi}, {tcidu}, {xatra}, {pixra}, {prina}, {finti} for 'author' or specific authorial works, {barna}, {pinka}.

ciste.definition: x1 (mass) is a system interrelated by structure x2 among components x3 (set) displaying x4 (ka).
ciste.notes: x1 (or x3) is synergistic in x4; also network; x2 also relations, rules; x3 also elements (set completely specified); x4 systemic functions/properties. See also cmavo list {ci'e}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {stura}, {tadji}, {munje}, {farvi}, {ganzu}, {judri}, {julne}, {klesi}, {morna}, {tcana}.

citno.definition: x1 is young/youthful [relatively short in elapsed duration] by standard x2.
citno.notes: Also age (= {nilnalci'o}); (adjective:) x1 is junior. See also {laldo}, {cnino}, {slabu}, {verba}.

citri.definition: x1 is a history of x2 according to x3 (person)/from point-of-view x3.

citsi.definition: x1 is a season/is seasonal [cyclical interval], defined by interval/property x2, of year(s) x3.
citsi.notes: Also anniversary (= {citsydei}, {na'arcitsydei}), jubilee (= {mumnoncitsi}); the period of time may be short or long as indicated by x2, and may occur every year or every nth year as indicated by x3 (default every year); (x2 and/or x3 may need metaphorical restriction: djecitsi, pavdeicitsi; also equinox, solstice, time of year. See also {cedra}, {crisa}, {critu}, {dunra}, {ranji}, {temci}, {vensa}, {jbena}.

civla.definition: x1 is a louse/flea [blood-sucking arthropod] of species/breed x2, parasitic on x3.

cizra.definition: x1 is strange/weird/deviant/bizarre/odd to x2 in property x3 (ka).
cizra.notes: Also alien, mysterious, deviant, queer, unusual, exotic. See also {ranxi}, {rirci}, {fange}, {banli}.

ckabu.definition: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of rubber/latex from source x2 of composition including x3.

ckafi.definition: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of coffee from source/bean/grain x2.
ckafi.notes: Brew based on a seed/bean/grain; e.g. also chicory coffee, decaf, postum. See also {tcati}, brewed from a leaf, {barja}, {cakla}.

ckaji.definition: x1 has/is characterized by property/feature/trait/aspect/dimension x2 (ka); x2 is manifest in x1.

ckana.definition: x1 is a bed/pallet of material x2 for holding/supporting x3 (person/object/event).

ckape.definition: x1 is perilous/dangerous/potentially harmful to x2 under conditions x3.
ckape.notes: x1 is a danger/peril to x2. See also te {bandu}, te {kajde}, te {marbi}, se {snura}, se {xalni}.

ckasu.definition: x1 ridicules/mocks/scoffs at x2 about x3 (property/event) by doing activity x4 (event).

ckeji.definition: x1 feels ashamed/mortified/humiliated under conditions x2 before community/audience x3.

ckiku.definition: x1 is a key fitting/releasing/opening/unlocking lock x2, and having relevant properties x3.
ckiku.notes: Also x2 fastener, mechanism; code key (= {termifckiku}, {kiktermifra}); x3 is dependent on the type of key, but are those form properties of the key that enable it to serve the function of opening the lock - in the case of a metal key to a padlock, for example, this would be the shaft and teeth. See also {stela}.

ckilu.definition: x1 (si'o) is a scale of units for measuring/observing/determining x2 (state).

ckini.definition: x1 is related to/associated with/akin to x2 by relationship x3.

ckire.definition: x1 is grateful/thankful to/appreciative of x2 for x3 (event/property).

ckule.definition: x1 is school/institute/academy at x2 teaching subject(s) x3 to audien./commun. x4 operated by x5.

ckunu.definition: x1 is a conifer/pine/fir of species/strain x2 with cones x3.

cladu.definition: x1 is loud/noisy at observation point x2 by standard x3.

clani.definition: x1 is long in dimension/direction x2 (default longest dimension) by measurement standard x3.

claxu.definition: x1 is without/lacking/free of/lacks x2; x1 is x2-less.

clika.definition: x1 is a moss/lichen of species/strain x2 growing on x3; (adjective:) x1 is mossy.

clira.definition: x1 (event) is early by standard x2.

clite.definition: x1 is polite/courteous/civil in matter x2 according to standard/custom x3.

cliva.definition: x1 leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from x2 via route x3.
cliva.notes: Also: x1 leaves behind/takes leave of x2. See also {litru}, {canci}, {vimcu}, {lebna}, {muvdu}.

clupa.definition: x1 is a loop/circuit of x2 [material].
clupa.notes: Also noose (= skoclupa, saljgeclupa; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= {cuptai}). See also {djine}.

cmaci.definition: x1 is a mathematics of type/describing x2.

cmalu.definition: x1 is small in property/dimension(s) x2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x3.

cmana.definition: x1 is a mountain/hill/mound/[rise]/[peak]/[summit]/[highlands] projecting from land mass x2.

cmavo.definition: x1 is a structure word of grammatical class x2, with meaning/function x3 in usage (language) x4.
cmavo.notes: x4 may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; x3 and x4 may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) ma'oste); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = ma'orpoi, ma'orselcmi, ma'orselste). See also {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}.

cmene.definition: x1 (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of x2 to/used-by namer/name-user x3 (person).
cmene.notes: Also: x2 is called x1 by x3 (= selcme for reordered places). See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}.

cmila.notes: x1 laughs at x2 (= {mi'afra}). See also {ckasu}, {frumu}, {xajmi}, {cisma}.

cmima.definition: x1 is a member/element of set x2; x1 belongs to group x2; x1 is amid/among/amongst group x2.
cmima.notes: x1 may be a complete or incomplete list of members; x2 is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership. See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

cmoni.definition: x1 utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] x2 expressing x3 (property).
cmoni.notes: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

cnano.definition: x1 [value] is a norm/average in property/amount x2 (ka/ni) among x3(s) (set) by standard x4.
cnano.notes: Also mean, normal, usual; (x3 specifies the complete set). See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

cnebo.definition: x1 is a/the neck [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].

cnemu.definition: x1 (agent) rewards x2 [recipient] for atypical x3 (event/property) with reward/desserts x4.
cnemu.notes: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); x4 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, posyvelne'u for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

cnici.definition: x1 is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity x2 (ka/ni).

cnino.definition: x1 is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer x2 in feature x3 (ka) by standard x4; x1 is a novelty.

cnisa.definition: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].

cnita.definition: x1 is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from x2 in frame of reference x3.

cokcu.definition: x1 soaks up/absorbs/sucks up x2 from x3 into x4; x1 is an absorbant.

condi.definition: x1 is deep in extent in direction/property x2 away from reference point x3 by standard x4.

cortu.definition: x1 hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus x2.

cpacu.definition: x1 gets/procures/acquires/obtains/accepts x2 from source x3 [previous possessor not implied].
cpacu.notes: Also fetch; accept a gift (= {seldu'acpa}). See also {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

cpana.definition: x1 is upon/atop/resting on/lying on [the upper surface of] x2 in frame of reference/gravity x3.
cpana.notes: (x1 may be object or event); See also se {vasru}, {jbini}, {zvati}, {nenri}, {vreta}, {ckana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {zutse}, {punji} for lay upon, {sarji}, {zbepi}.

cpare.definition: x1 climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on surface x2 in direction x3 using x4 [limbs/tools].

cpedu.definition: x1 requests/asks/petitions/solicits for x2 of/from x3 in manner/form x4.
cpedu.notes: Also demand (= {mi'ecpe}); x4 is a means of expression See also ve {cusku}.: a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor). (cf. pikci, te preti, te frati, se spuda, danfu)

cpina.definition: x1 is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense x2.

cradi.definition: x1 broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] x2 via station/frequency x3 to [radio] receiver x4.
cradi.notes: Also x1 is a broadcaster. See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

crane.definition: x1 is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of x2 which faces/in-frame-of-reference x3.
crane.notes: Also: x3 is the standard of orientation for x2. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

creka.definition: x1 is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material x2.

crepu.definition: x1 (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects x2 from source/area x3.

cribe.definition: x1 is a bear/ursoid of species/breed x2.

crida.definition: x1 is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion x2.
crida.notes: Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman. (cf. {ranmi}, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, {lijda})

cripu.definition: x1 is a bridge/span over/across x2 between x3 and x4 [unordered, typically destination first].

crisa.definition: x1 is summer/summertime [hot season] of year x2 at location x3.

critu.definition: x1 is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year x2 at location x3.

ctaru.definition: x1 is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in x2 caused by x3.

ctebi.definition: x1 is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice x2 of body x3; (adjective:) x1 is labial.

cteki.definition: x1 is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event x2 levied against x3 by authority/collector x4.
cteki.notes: Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

ctile.definition: x1 is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source x2.

ctino.definition: x1 is a shadow/the shade of object x2, made by light/energy source x3.

ctuca.definition: x1 teaches audience x2 ideas/methods/lore x3 (du'u) about subject(s) x4 by method x5 (event).
ctuca.notes: Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) x1/x5 is pedagogical. See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

cukla.definition: x1 is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; x1 is a disk/circle/ring.
cukla.notes: Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'. See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

cukta.definition: x1 is a book containing work x2 by author x3 for audience x4 preserved in medium x5.
cukta.notes: [x1 is a manifestation/container A physical object or its analogue. of a work/content, not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri})]; See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

culno.definition: x1 is full/completely filled with x2.

cumki.definition: x1 (event/state/property) is possible under conditions x2; x1 may/might occur; x1 is a maybe.

cumla.definition: x1 is humble/modest about x2 (abstraction); x1 displays humility about x2.

cunmi.definition: x1 is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain x2.

cunso.definition: x1 is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions x2, with probability distribution x3.
cunso.notes: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = cuncu'a, cunselcu'a, cunjdi, cunseljdi; based on "unpredictable"). See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

cuntu.definition: x1 is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) x2 (ind./mass); x1 is x2's business.
cuntu.notes: Also matter, concern; x2 is engaged in x1 (which is usually an abstraction) (= selcu'u for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

cupra.definition: x1 produces x2 [product] by process x3.

curmi.definition: x1 (agent) lets/permits/allows x2 (event) under conditions x3; x1 grants privilege x2.
curmi.notes: Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}). See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

curnu.definition: x1 is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed x2.
curnu.notes: Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because many multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike. See also {since}, {silka}.

curve.definition: x1 is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property x2 (ka).
curve.notes: x1 is simply/purely/unmitigatedly/solely x2. See also {prane}, {jinsa}, {manfo}, {sampu}, {sepli}, {traji}, {lumci}, {xukmi}.

cusku.definition: x1 (agent) expresses/says x2 (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience x3 via expressive medium x4.
cusku.notes: Also says. See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

cutci.definition: x1 is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] x2, and of material x3.

cutne.definition: x1 is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of x2.

cuxna.definition: x1 chooses/selects x2 [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives x3 (complete set).

dacru.definition: x1 is a drawer/file in structure x2, a [sliding compartment] container for contents x3.

dacti.definition: x1 is a material object enduring in space-time; x1 is a thing.

dadjo.definition: x1 pertains to the Taoist culture/ethos/religion in aspect x2.

dakfu.definition: x1 is a knife (tool) for cutting x2, with blade of material x3.

dakli.definition: x1 is a sack/bag with contents x2, and of material x3.

damba.definition: x1 fights/combats/struggles with x2 over issue x3 (abstract); x1 is a fighter/combatant.
damba.notes: Use x3 tu'a for fight over an object/objective. See also {bradi}, {gunta}, {talsa}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {jamna}, {sonci}.

damri.definition: x1 is a drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] with beater/actuator x2.

dandu.definition: x1 hangs/dangles/is suspended from x2 by/at/with joint x3.
dandu.notes: Pendant (= {dadja'i}); also dependent (original meaning). See also {lasna}, {jorne}.

danfu.definition: x1 is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem x2.
danfu.notes: (cf. ciksi, frati, preti, nabmi, spuda for agentive response/reply, cpedu)

danlu.definition: x1 is an animal/creature of species x2; x1 is biologically animate.

danmo.definition: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity of smoke/smog/air pollution from source x2.
danmo.notes: x2 may be a fire. See also {pulce}, {gapci}, {sigja}, {bumru}.

danre.definition: x1 (force) puts pressure on/presses/applies force to x2.

dansu.definition: x1 (individual, mass) dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm x2.

danti.definition: x1 is a ballistic projectile [e.g. bullet/missile] for firing by [gun/propelling launcher] x2.
danti.notes: Also cannonball, catapult stone, shot pellet(s). See also {cecla}, {renro}, {jakne}.

daplu.definition: x1 is an island/atoll/key of [material/properties] x2 in surroundings/body x3; x1 is insular.

dapma.definition: x1 curses/damns/condemns x2 to fate (event) x3.
dapma.notes: Curse with a specific expression (= {dapsku}). See also {mabla}, {dimna}, {cnemu}, {sfasa}, {dunda}, {cusku}, {cirko}, {jdima}, {di'ai}.

dargu.definition: x1 is a road/highway to x2 from x3 with route x4 (x2/x3 may be unordered).
dargu.notes: A regularly used, improved-for-use surface for travelling. See also {naxle}, {tcana}, {pluta}, {klaji}.

darlu.definition: x1 argues for stand x2 against stand x3; [an opponent is not necessary].

darno.definition: x1 is far/distant from x2 in property x3 (ka).

darsi.definition: x1 shows audacity/chutzpah in behavior x2 (event/activity); x1 dares to do/be x2 (event/ka).

darxi.definition: x1 hits/strikes/[beats] x2 with instrument [or body-part] x3 at locus x4.

daski.definition: x1 is a pocket/pouch of/in garment/item x2.

dasni.definition: x1 wears/is robed/garbed in x2 as a garment of type x3.
dasni.notes: x2 need not be intended for use as a garment (unlike taxfu). See also {taxfu}.

daspo.definition: x1 (event) destroys/ruins/wrecks/despoils x2; x1 is destructive.

dasri.definition: x1 is a ribbon/tape/strip/band/stripe of material x2.

datka.definition: x1 is a duck/[drake] of species/breed x2.

datni.definition: x1 (du'u) [fact/measurement] is data/information/statistic(s) about x2 gathered by method x3.
datni.notes: Evidence (= velji'i datni or just {velji'i}, {sidydatni}). See also {fatci}, {saske}, {vreji}.

decti.definition: x1 is a tenth [1/10; $1*10^{-1}$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).
decti.notes: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

degji.definition: x1 is a/the finger/digit/toe [body-part] on limb/body site x2 of body x3; [metaphor: peninsula].

dejni.definition: x1 owes x2 in debt/obligation to creditor x3 in return for x4 [service, loan]; x1 is a debtor.

dekpu.definition: x1 is x2 (default 1) local volume unit(s) [non-metric; e.g. bushel], standard x3, x4 subunits.
dekpu.notes: Gallon (= {likydekpu}), quart (= {likseldekpu}), barrel (wet = likybradekpu, dry = sudbradekpu), bushel (= {sudydekpu}), peck (= {sudyseldekpu}), cupful (= {kabrydekpu}), tablespoon (= {mucydekpu}); teaspoon (= {mucyseldekpu}); (all of these lujvo may need gic- to distinguish the English measurement system in contrasting with some local system; the English system is otherwise presumed to be the default non-metric system). (additional subunit places may be added as x5, x6, ...); See also {canlu}, {litce}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

dekto.definition: x1 is ten [10; $1*10^1$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

delno.definition: x1 is x2 candela [metric unit] in luminosity (default is 1) by standard x3.

dembi.definition: x1 is a bean/pea/leguminous seed from plant [legume] x2.

denci.definition: x1 is a/the tooth [body-part] of x2; (adjective:) x1 is dental.

denmi.definition: x1 is dense/concentrated/packed/intense in property x2 (ka) at location/locus x3.

denpa.definition: x1 awaits/waits/pauses for/until x2 at state x3 before starting/continuing x4 (activity/process).
denpa.notes: (x2 is an event, usually a point event); also: resuming x4. See also {dicra}, {fanmo}, {sisti}, {fliba}, {pandi}.

dertu.definition: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of dirt/soil/earth/ground from source x2 of composition x3.
dertu.notes: Also: x1 is earthen; x3: composition including x3, which need not be exhaustive of composition. See also {kliti}, {terdi}, {loldi}.

derxi.definition: x1 is a heap/pile/stack/mound/hill of materials x2 at location x3.

desku.notes: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal motion. See also {slilu}, {janbe}.

detri.definition: x1 is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state x2, at location x3, by calendar x4.
detri.notes: (time units in x1 are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); See also cmavo list {de'i}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

dicra.definition: x1 (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] x2 (object/event/process) due to quality x3.

dikca.definition: x1 is electricity [electric charge or current] in/on x2 of polarity/quantity x3 (def. negative).
dikca.notes: (x3, a quantifier, can be expressed as a simple polarity using the numerals for positive and negative ma'u and ni'u); (explicitly) negative (= {dutydikca}), positive (= {mardikca}); current (= (sel)muvdikca; again default negative/electron current), charge (= {klodikca}, {stadikca}). See also {lindi}, {xampo}, {flecu}, {maksi}, {tcana}.

diklo.definition: x1 is local to x2; x1 is confined to locus x2 within range x3; x1 is regional
diklo.notes: Indicates a specific location/value within a range; e.g. a hits b. What is the locality on b that a hits? Thus x1 is associated with a specific narrow region/interval x2 of wider space/range x3. See also cmavo list {di'o}, {jibni}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {nenri}, {lamji}, {stuzi}, {tcila}.

dikni.definition: x1 is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity x2 with period/interval x3.

dilcu.definition: x1 is a quotient of 'x2/x3' [dividend x2 divided by divisor x3], leaving remainder x4.

dilnu.definition: x1 is a cloud/mass of clouds of material x2 in air mass x3 at floor/base elevation x4.

dimna.definition: x1 is a fate/destiny of x2; [doom, curse are mabla-forms]; x2 is fated/predestined/doomed to x1.

dinju.definition: x1 is a building/edifice for purpose x2.

dinko.definition: x1 is a nail/tack [pointed driven/frictional fastener] of type/size x2 (ka), made of material x3.
dinko.notes: (x2 also can be ni abstraction); See also {pijne}, {lasna}.

dirba.definition: x1 is dear/precious/darling to x2; x1 is emotionally valued by x2.
dirba.notes: x1 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydirba for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {tcika}, {kargu}, {vamji}, {vajni}, {pleji}, {jadni}, {jemna}.

dirce.definition: x1 radiates/emits x2 under conditions x3.

dirgo.definition: x1 is a drop [small, cohesive shape] of material [liquid/vapor] x2 in surrounding material x3.

dizlo.definition: x1 is low/down/downward in frame of reference x2 as compared with baseline/standard height x3.
dizlo.notes: Also lower; x3 is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself. See also {cnita}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {farna}, {loldi}.

djacu.definition: x1 is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of water; (adjective:) x1 is aqueous/[aquatic].

djedi.definition: x1 is x2 full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard x3; (adjective:) x1 is diurnal.

djica.definition: x1 desires/wants/wishes x2 (event/state) for purpose x3.
djica.notes: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in x2 (or use lujvo = po'edji). See also {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}.

djine.definition: x1 is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material x2, inside diam. x3, outside diam. x4.
djine.notes: Also ellipse, oval (= {jincla}); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops). Also band, belt, encircle (= {jinsru}). See also {clupa}, {cukla}, {dasri}, {karli}, {sovda}, {sruri}, {konju}.

djuno.definition: x1 knows fact(s) x2 (du'u) about subject x3 by epistemology x4.
djuno.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= {tadjyju'o}). (cf. know/familiar with: se slabu, na'e cnino, na'e fange; cmavo list du'o, cilre, certu, facki, jijnu, jimpe, senpi, smadi, kakne, birti, mipri, morji, saske, viska)

donri.definition: x1 is the daytime of day x2 at location x3; (adjective:) x1 is diurnal (vs. nocturnal).

dotco.definition: x1 reflects German/Germanic culture/nationality/language in aspect x2.

draci.definition: x1 is a drama/play about x2 [plot/theme/subject] by dramatist x3 for audience x4 with actors x5.
draci.notes: x2 may also be a convention. See also {finti}, {cukta}, {lisri}, {cfika}.

drani.definition: x1 is correct/proper/right/perfect in property/aspect x2 (ka) in situation x3 by standard x4.

drata.definition: x1 isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than x2 by standard x3; x1 is something else.

drudi.definition: x1 is a roof/top/ceiling/lid of x2.
drudi.notes: (cf. bitmu, stedu, galtu, gapru, loldi, marbi, gacri, mapku; a drudi is (designed to be) over/above something and shelters it from other things above the drudi, mapku)

dugri.definition: x1 is the logarithm of x2 with base x3.

dukse.definition: x1 is an excess of/too much of x2 by standard x3.

dukti.definition: x1 is polar opposite from/contrary to x2 in property/on scale x3 (property/si'o).

dunda.definition: x1 [donor] gives/donates gift/present x2 to recipient/beneficiary x3 [without payment/exchange].
dunda.notes: Also grants; x3 is a receiver (= terdu'a for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydu'a}, posyseldu'a for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {benji}, {muvdu}, {canja}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {friti}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {cnemu}, {prali}.

dunja.definition: x1 freezes/jells/solidifies at temperature x2 and pressure x3.

dunku.definition: x1 is anguished/distressed/emotionally wrought/stressed by x2.

dunli.definition: x1 is equal/congruent to/as much as x2 in property/dimension/quantity x3.
dunli.notes: Same in quantity/quality (not necessarily in identity); 'analogy' may be expressed as the equivalence of two properties of similarity (ka x1 simsa x2) and (ka x3 simsa x4). See also cmavo list {du'i}, {satci}, {frica}, {simsa}, {mintu}.

dunra.definition: x1 is winter/wintertime [cold season] of year x2 at location x3.

dzena.definition: x1 is an elder/ancestor of x2 by bond/tie/degree x3; x1's generation precedes x2's parents.

dzipo.definition: x1 reflects Antarctican culture/nationality/geography in aspect x2.

facki.definition: x1 discovers/finds out x2 (du'u) about subject/object x3; x1 finds (fi) x3 (object).

fadni.definition: x1 [member] is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property x2 (ka) among members of x3 (set).
fadni.notes: Also: x2 is a normal/common/ordinary/typical property among set x3 (= selterfadni for reordered places); also regular, (mabla forms:) banal, trite, vulgar; (x3 is complete set). See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tcaci}, {cnano}.

fagri.definition: x1 is a fire/flame in fuel x2 burning-in/reacting-with oxidizer x3 (default air/oxygen).

falnu.definition: x1 is a sail for gathering propelling material x2 on vehicle/motor x3.

famti.definition: x1 is an aunt/uncle of x2 by bond/tie x3; x1 is an associated member of x2's parent's generation.

fancu.definition: x1 is a function/single-valued mapping from domain x2 to range x3 defined by expression/rule x4.

fange.definition: x1 is alien/foreign/[exotic]/unfamiliar to x2 in property x3 (ka).

fanmo.definition: x1 is an end/finish/termination of thing/process x2; [not necessarily implying completeness].
fanmo.notes: x1 is final/last/at the last; x1 is a terminal/terminus of x2; x1 is the final/terminated state of terminated process x2; x2 terminates/ceases/stops/halts at x1 (= selfa'o for reordered places). See also {krasi}, {cfari}, {mulno}, {sisti}, {denpa}, {jipno}, {kojna}, {traji}, {krasi}.

fanri.definition: x1 is a factory/foundry/industrial plant/mill producing x2 from materials x3.

fanta.definition: x1 prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event x2 from occurring.

fanva.definition: x1 translates text/utterance x2 to language x3 from language x4 with translation result x5.

fanza.notes: Also: is disruptive to. See also {fengu}, {raktu}, {dicra}, {tunta}, {zunti}, {jicla}.

fapro.definition: x1 opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) x2 (person/force ind./mass) about x3 (abstract).

farlu.definition: x1 falls/drops to x2 from x3 in gravity well/frame of reference x4.
farlu.notes: Note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive "drop" = one of two lujvo: falcru and falri'a). See also {lafti}, {cpare}, {klama}, {sfubu}.

farna.definition: x1 is the direction of x2 (object/event) from origin/in frame of reference x3.
farna.notes: x2 is towards x1 from x3 (= selfa'a for reordered places). See also {zunle}, {pritu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {cnita}, {dizlo}, {berti}, {snanu}, {stuna}, {stici}, {purci}, {balvi}, {lidne}.

farvi.definition: x1 develops/evolves towards/into x2 from x3 through stages x4.

fasnu.definition: x1 (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; x1 is an incident/happening/occurrence.
fasnu.notes: (cf. cmavo list fau, krefu, lifri, fatci, rapli; gasnu, zukte, if specifically agentive, banli)

fatci.definition: x1 (du'u) is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute.

fatne.definition: x1 [sequence] is in reverse order from x2 [sequence]; x1 (object) is inverted from x2 (object).
fatne.notes: Also opposite (one sense). See also cmavo list {fa'e}, {dukti}.

fatri.definition: x1 is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among x2 with shares/portions x3; (x2/x3 fa'u).
fatri.notes: Also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= {fairgau}, {fairzu'e}). See also cmavo list {fa'u}, {fendi}, {preja}, {katna}, {tcana}.

febvi.definition: x1 boils/evaporates at temperature x2 and pressure x3.

femti.definition: x1 is $10^{-15}$ of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

fendi.definition: x1 (agent) divides/partitions/separates x2 into sections/parts/ind. x3 by method/partition x4.

fengu.definition: x1 is angry/mad at x2 for x3 (action/state/property).

fenki.definition: x1 (action/event) is crazy/insane/mad/frantic/in a frenzy (one sense) by standard x2.

fenso.definition: x1 sews/stitches/sutures materials x2 (ind./set) together with tool(s) x3, using filament x4.
fenso.notes: (x2 if a set must be a complete specification); See also {cilta}, {jivbu}, {jorne}, {nivji}, {pijne}, {lasna}.

fepni.definition: x1 is measured in kopeck/cent money-subunits as x2 [quantity], in monetary system x3.
fepni.notes: Also pfennig, paisa, sen, fen, dinar, etc.; x1 is generally a price/cost/value. (additional secondary, tertiary, etc. subunit places may be added as x4, x5, x6, ...); See also {sicni}, {jdini}, {jdima}, {vecnu}, {rupnu}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

fepri.definition: x1 is a/the lung [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: breathing/respiratory apparatus/bellows].
fepri.notes: Also (adjective:) x1 is pulmonary. See also {pambe}, {vasxu}.

ferti.definition: x1 is fertile/conducive for supporting the growth/development of x2; x1 is fruitful/prolific.
ferti.notes: Also fecund (note that the Lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility). See also {vanbi}, {sidju}, {rorci}, {farvi}, {banro}, {cange}.

festi.definition: x1(s) is/are waste product(s) [left to waste] by x2 (event/activity).
festi.notes: Also shit, crap; agentive wasting (= {fesygau}, {fesyzu'e}). See also {xaksu}, {kalci}, {pinca}.

fetsi.definition: x1 is a female/doe of species x2 evidencing feminine trait(s) x3 (ka); x1 is feminine.

figre.definition: x1 is a fig [fruit/tree] of species/strain x2.

filso.definition: x1 reflects Palestinian culture/nationality in aspect x2.

finpe.definition: x1 is a fish of species x2 [metaphorical extension to sharks, non-fish aquatic vertebrates].

finti.definition: x1 invents/creates/composes/authors x2 for function/purpose x3 from existing elements/ideas x4.
finti.notes: x1 is creative/inventive. See also cmavo list {fi'e}, {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, specific works of authorship, {prosa}, {skina}.

flalu.definition: x1 is a law specifying x2 (state/event) for community x3 under conditions x4 by lawgiver(s) x5.
flalu.notes: x1 is a legality; x2 is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= selfla for reordered places). See also {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}.

flani.definition: x1 is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument].

flecu.definition: x1 is a current/flow/river of/in x2 flowing in direction to/towards x3 from direction/source x4.
flecu.notes: [x1 is a stream of x2; x2 is a fluid Gas or liquid. (= {selfle} for reordered places); x1 flushes toward x3; flush (= {caifle}, {sukfle})]; See also {rirxe}, {senta} where no directionality is implied, {rinci}, {xampo}, {dikca}, {sakci}, {gapci}, {litki}, {ciblu}.

fliba.definition: x1 fails at doing x2 (state/event); x1 is a failure at its role in x2.
fliba.notes: Baffled (= {pesfli}, {jmifli}, {dafspufli}, {menfli}, among other senses); also x2 ceases/does not complete/fails to continue due to failure on the part of x1. See also {cfila}, {snada}, {srera}, {troci}, {sisti}, {ranji}, {denpa}, {bebna}, {zunti}.

flira.definition: x1 is a/the face [head/body-part] of x2; (adjective:) x1 is facial.

foldi.definition: x1 is a field [shape/form] of material x2; x1 is a broad uniform expanse of x2.
foldi.notes: Also woods (= {ricfoi}), lawn/meadow (= {sasfoi}), brush (= {spafoi}, {cicyspafoi}). See also {purdi}, {cange}.

fonmo.definition: x1 is a quantity of foam/froth/suds of material x2, with bubbles/vacuoles of material x3.

fonxa.definition: x1 is a telephone transceiver/modem attached to system/network x2.

forca.definition: x1 is a fork/fork-type tool/utensil for purpose x2 with tines/prongs x3 on base/support x4.

fraso.definition: x1 reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect x2.

frati.definition: x1 reacts/responds/answers with action x2 to stimulus x3 under conditions x4; x1 is responsive.
frati.notes: x3 stimulates x1 into reaction x2, x3 stimulates reaction x2 (= {terfra} for place reordering); attempt to stimulate, prod (= {terfratoi}, {tunterfratoi}). See also {preti}, {danfu}, {spuda}, {cpedu}, {tarti}.

fraxu.definition: x1 forgives x2 for event/state/activity x3.

frica.definition: x1 differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike x2 in property/dimension/quantity x3.
frica.notes: Also other-than (less common meaning). See also {ranxi}, {drata}, {dunli}, {simsa}, {vrici}.

friko.definition: x1 reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect x2.

frili.definition: x1 (action) is easy/simple/facile for x2 (agent) under conditions x3; x2 does x1 freely/easily.

frinu.definition: x1 is a fraction, with numerator x2, denominator x3 (x2/x3).

friti.definition: x1 offers/proffers x2 [offering] to x3 with conditions x4.
friti.notes: (x4 may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, posyselfriti for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.

frumu.notes: x1 frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to x2 (= {frufra}). See also {cmila}, {cisma}.

fukpi.definition: x1 is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of x2 in form/medium x3 made by method x4 (event).

fulta.definition: x1 (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) x2; x1 is buoyant.

funca.definition: x1 (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of x2; (note mabla/zabna not implied).

fusra.definition: x1 rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent x2; x1 is rotten/decayed/fermented.

fuzme.definition: x1 is responsible/accountable for x2 (action/resulting state) to judge/authority x3.

gacri.definition: x1 is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering x2.

gadri.definition: x1 is an article/descriptor labelling description x2 (text) in language x3 with semantics x4.
gadri.notes: x2 is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description ((x1 with x2) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu. 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

galfi.notes: Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}). (cf. stika for non-resultative, binxo for not-necessarily causal change, cenba for non-resultative change; zasni)

galtu.definition: x1 is high/up/upward in frame of reference x2 as compared with baseline/standard height x3.
galtu.notes: Also upper; x3 is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself. See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

galxe.definition: x1 is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].

ganlo.definition: x1 (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to x2 by x3.
ganlo.notes: As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.

ganra.definition: x1 is broad/wide in dimension x2 [2nd most significant dimension] by standard x3.

ganse.definition: x1 [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus property x2 (ka) by means x3 under conditions x4.
ganse.notes: x1 is sensitive to x2; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates x1 and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); x3 sense/sensory channel. See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.

ganti.definition: x1 is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of x2, gender x3.

ganxo.definition: x1 is a/the anus/anal orifice/asshole/arsehole [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: exit, waste exit].
ganxo.notes: Also asshole/ass/arsehole; (adjective:) x1 is anal. See also {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}.

ganzu.definition: x1 organizes x2 [relative chaos] into x3 [ordered/organized result] by system/principle(s) x4.
ganzu.notes: x3 is also a system; x4 could be merely a function which inherently serves to dictate the organizational structure of x3. See also {ciste}, {morna}, {stura}, {bilni}, {cabra}.

gapci.definition: x1 is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including x2, under conditions x3.
gapci.notes: x3 includes temperature and pressure. See also {pambe}, {vacri}, {litki}, {sligu}, {danmo}, {bumru}, {cidro}, {flecu}.

gapru.definition: x1 is directly/vertically above/upwards-from x2 in gravity/frame of reference x3.

garna.definition: x1 is a rail/railing/bar [tool] supporting/restraining x2, of material x3.

gasnu.definition: x1 [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event x2; x1 does/brings about x2.
gasnu.notes: (cf. cmavo list gau, gunka, zukte, rinka, fasnu for non-agentive events, jibri, kakne, pilno)

gasta.definition: x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains steel of composition including x2.

genja.definition: x1 is a root [body-part] of plant/species x2; [metaphor: immobile, supporting, nourishing].

gento.definition: x1 reflects Argentinian culture/nationality in aspect x2.

genxu.definition: x1 is a hook/crook [shape/form] of material x2.

gerku.definition: x1 is a dog/canine/[bitch] of species/breed x2.

gerna.definition: x1 is the grammar/rules/defining form of language x2 for structure/text x3.

gidva.definition: x1 (person/object/event) guides/conducts/pilots/leads x2 (active participants) in/at x3 (event).
gidva.notes: A guiding person advises/suggests/sets an example to be followed, but does not necessarily control/direct/manage actual execution of an event; an event may serve as a guide by setting a pattern/example to be emulated. See also {jitro}, {ralju}, {sazri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {fukpi}, {morna}.

gigdo.definition: x1 is a billion [British milliard] [$10^9$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

ginka.definition: x1 is a camp/encampment/temporary residence of x2 at location x3.

girzu.definition: x1 is group/cluster/team showing common property (ka) x2 due to set x3 linked by relations x4.
girzu.notes: Also collection, team, comprised of, comprising; members x3 (a specification of the complete membership) comprise group x1; cluster (= {kangri}). See also {bende}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {gunma}, {panra}, {cabra}, {cecmu}, {kansa}, {klesi}, {lanzu}, {liste}, {vrici}.

gismu.definition: x1 is a (Lojban) root word expressing relation x2 among argument roles x3, with affix(es) x4.
gismu.notes: Gismu list, if physical object (= ({loi}) {gimste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new gismu to the gismu list = {gimpoi}, {gimselcmi}, {gimselste}). See also {cmavo}, {cmene}, {lujvo}, {smuni}, {sumti}, {tanru}, {valsi}.

glare.definition: x1 is hot/[warm] by standard x2.

gletu.definition: x1 copulates/fucks/mates/has coitus/sexual intercourse with x2.
gletu.notes: x1 and x2 are symmetrical; mounts (= {cpanygle}). See also {cinse}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {mabla}, {speni}.

glico.definition: x1 is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect x2.
glico.notes: Generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = gligu'e, or simply redundancy = gligli-); British English, the norm language of the UK (= {gliglibau}). (cf. {brito} which refers to the United Kingdom as a whole or to the British empire, {merko}, {sralo}, {kadno}, {skoto})

gluta.definition: x1 is a mitten/glove [hand and lower arm garment] of material x2.

gocti.definition: x1 is $10^{-24}$ of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

gotro.definition: x1 is $10^{24}$ of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units).

gradu.definition: x1 [magnitude] is a unit/degree of/on scale/reference standard x2 (si'o) measuring property x3.
gradu.notes: Also grade, level, point; x3 dimension. See also {ckilu}, {kantu}, {kelvo}, {merli}, {ranti}, {selci}.

grake.definition: x1 is x2 gram(s) [metric unit] in mass (default is 1) by standard x3.

grana.definition: x1 is a rod/pole/staff/stick/cane [shape/form] of material x2.

grasu.definition: x1 is a quantity of/is made of/contains grease/fat/oil from source x2.

greku.definition: x1 is a frame/structure/skeleton/outline supporting/load-bearing/determining the form of x2.

grute.definition: x1 is a fruit [body-part] of species x2.

gubni.definition: x1 is public/un-hidden/open/jointly available to/owned by all among community x2 (mass).

gugde.definition: x1 is the country of peoples x2 with land/territory x3; (people/territory relationship).
gugde.notes: Also sovereignty, domestic (as opposed to foreign), nation (when not referring to ethos). See also {turni}, {natmi}, {jecta}, {tumla}, {tutra}, {lanci}.

gundi.definition: x1 is industry/industrial/systematic manufacturing activity producing x2 by process/means x3.

gunka.definition: x1 [person] labors/works on/at x2 [activity] with goal/objective x3.
gunka.notes: Also: x1 is a worker/laborer. (cf. {sazri}, {gasnu}, {se} {jibri}; {zukte} - which need not be labor; physics term 'work' = {ni} {muvyselbai}, {briju}, {jibri}, {lazni}, {selfu})

gunma.definition: x1 is a mass/team/aggregate/whole, together composed of components x2, considered jointly.
gunma.notes: A description in x1 indicates of mass property(ies) displayed by the mass; masses may reveal properties not found in the individual set members that are massified, which themselves are not necessarily relevant to the mass property implicit in this bridi. See also {bende}, {girzu}, {pagbu}, cmavo list {loi}, {lei}, {lai}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {kansa}, {tinci}, {mulgunma}.

gunro.definition: x1 rolls/trundles on/against surface x2 rotating on axis/axle x3; x1 is a roller.

gunse.definition: x1 is a goose/[gander] of species/breed x2.

gunta.definition: x1 (person/mass) attacks/invades/commits aggression upon victim x2 with goal/objective x3.

gurni.definition: x1 is grain/[British: corn]/cereal from plant/species x2.

guska.definition: x1 blade/scraper/erosive scrapes/erodes/abrades x2 from x3.

gusni.definition: x1 [energy] is light/illumination illuminating x2 from light source x3.
gusni.notes: [x3 illuminates/lights x2 with light/illumination x1; x2 is lit/illuminated by illumination x1 from source x3 (= selgu'i for reordered places); light/lamp (= tergu'i)](cf. dirce, manku, solri, carmi, ctino, kantu)

gusta.definition: x1 is a restaurant/cafe/diner serving type-of-food x2 to audience x3.

gutci.definition: x1 is x2 (default 1) short local distance unit(s) [non-metric], standard x3, x4 subunits.
gutci.notes: Foot (= {jmagutci}); yard (= {cibjmagutci}), pace (= {tapygutci}), inch (= {degygutci}), cubit (= {birgutci}). (additional subunit places may be added as x5, x6, ...); See also {mitre}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

gutra.definition: x1 is a/the womb/uterus [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: nourishing, protective, giving birth].

guzme.definition: x1 is a melon/squash [fruit/plant] of species/strain x2.

jabre.definition: x1 brakes/causes to slow motion/activity x2 with device/mechanism/principle x3.

jadni.definition: x1 (object) adorns/decorates x2; x1 is an adornment/decoration of x2; x2 is fancy/decorated.

jakne.definition: x1 is a rocket [vehicle] propelled by jet expelling x2 carrying payload x3.

jalge.definition: x1 (action/event/state) is a result/outcome/conclusion of antecedent x2 (event/state/process).
jalge.notes: Also: x2 gives rise to x1 (= selja'e for reordered places); total (general meaning, but also = mekyja'e, pi'irja'e, sujyja'e). See also se {mukti}, te {zukte}, se {rinka}, se {krinu}, se {nibli}, {mulno}, {sumji}, {pilji}, {mekso}, cmavo list {ja'e}, {ciksi}.

jalna.definition: x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of starch from source x2 of composition including x3.

jalra.definition: x1 is a cockroach/orthopteran/termite of order/species/breed x2.
jalra.notes: Also grasshopper (= {pipyjalra}); cricket (= {sagjalra}); locust, termite (= mantyjalra or {mudyctijalra}). (Orthoptera includes grasshoppers, crickets, etc; termites are a closely-related non-Orthoptera, more akin to cockroaches than to e.g. ants); See also {cinki}, {civla}, {manti}.

jamfu.definition: x1 is a/the foot [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: lowest portion] (adjective:) x1 is pedal.

jamna.definition: x1 (person/mass) wars against x2 over territory/matter x3; x1 is at war with x2.

janbe.definition: x1 is a bell/chime/[tuning fork] [tuned percussion instrument] producing sound/note x2.
janbe.notes: Also: x1 rings/tolls (i.e. if it rings, then it is a bell); resonates (one sense, = jabdesku). See also {zgike}, {tonga}, {desku}, {slilu}.

janco.definition: x1 is a/the shoulder/hip/joint [body-part] attaching limb/extremity x2 to body x3.

janli.notes: (also collide = simjanli for a collision between two moving objects); See also {darxi}.

jansu.definition: x1 is a diplomat/consul representing polity x2 in/at negotiation x3 for function/purpose x4.
jansu.notes: (for) x3 polity, (use tu'a); also ambassador (= {raljansu}, {trujansu}). See also {jecta}, {krati}.

janta.definition: x1 is an account/bill/invoice for goods/services x2, billed to x3 by x4.

jarbu.definition: x1 is a suburban area of city/metropolis x2.

jarco.notes: [reveal (= {tolmipygau}, {mipyja'o}, {sivja'o}); also: x1 shows that x2, x1 shows off x2; showing an object is generally expressed with a {tu'a} x2, since the properties of the shown object (other than its presence) intended for observation are seldom specified (simple presence could be expressed by {leka} Object. {cu} {zvati})]; See also {tigni}, {cipra}, {zgana}, {jvinu}, {lanli}, {mipri}, {simlu}.

jarki.definition: x1 is narrow in dimension x2 [2nd most significant dimension] by standard x3.

jaspu.definition: x1 is a passport issued to x2 (person) by authority x3 allowing x4 (activity).

jatna.definition: x1 is captain/commander/leader/in-charge/boss of vehicle/domain x2.

javni.definition: x1 is a rule prescribing/mandating/requiring x2 (event/state) within system/community x3.
javni.notes: Regulation, prescription (also x2), principle, requirement (also x2), prescribe, require (conditions are usually contained within x2); x1 is regulatory; x2, x3 are regulated. See also {flalu}, {ritli}, cmavo list {ja'i}, {marde}, {tcaci}, {tinbe}, {zekri}.

jbama.definition: x1 is a bomb/explosive device with explosive material/principle x2.

jbari.definition: x1 is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species x2.

jbena.definition: x1 is born to x2 at time x3 [birthday] and place x4 [birthplace]; x1 is native to (fo) x4.
jbena.notes: x2 bears/gives birth to x1; also x3: natal day. See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.

jbera.definition: x1 (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes x2 (object) from source x3 for interval x4.
jbera.notes: Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}). See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.

jbini.definition: x1 is between/among set of points/bounds/limits x2 (set)/amidst mass x2 in property x3 (ka).
jbini.notes: x2 (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for x1. See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.

jdari.definition: x1 is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force x2 under conditions x3.

jdice.definition: x1 (person) decides/makes decision x2 (du'u) about matter x3 (event/state).

jdika.definition: x1 (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity x2 by amount x3.

jdima.definition: x1 [amount] is the price of x2 to purchaser/consumer x3 set by vendor x4.
jdima.notes: x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace). See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.

jdini.definition: x1 is money/currency issued by x2; (adjective:) x1 is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
jdini.notes: 'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}). See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}.

jduli.definition: x1 is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including x2.

jecta.definition: x1 is a polity/state governing territory/domain x2; [government/territory relationship].

jeftu.definition: x1 is x2 weeks in duration (default is 1 week) by standard x3.
jeftu.notes: Re. x3, a week may be more or less than seven days, classically being tied to the time between trips to the marketplace; this week (= {cabjeftu}); next week (= {bavlamjeftu}); last week (= {prulamjeftu}). See also {detri}, {djedi}, {masti}, {nanca}.

jegvo.definition: x1 pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem (Abrahamic) culture/religion/nationality in aspect x2.

jelca.definition: x1 burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature x2 in atmosphere x3.
jelca.notes: Default x2/x3 to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = jelka'e or jelfrili). See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.

jemna.definition: x1 is a gem/polished stone/pearl of type x2 from gemstone/material/source x3.
jemna.notes: Also jewel (= {jmeja'i}); gemstone (= x2, x3, or jmero'i, jmekunra); pearl (= selcakyjme - a gem found inside a shell, tercakyjme - a gem made of shell material, boijme - any ball-shaped gem), mother-of-pearl (= {cakyjme}). See also {kunra}, {rokci}, {jadni}, {dirba}, {kargu}, {krili}, {pulji}.

jendu.definition: x1 is an axle/spindle [tool] on which x2 rotates, of material/properties x3.

jenmi.definition: x1 (mass) is an army serving group/community x2 (mass) in function x3 (activity).

jerna.definition: x1 (agent/person) earns/[deserves/merits] wages/salary/pay x2 for work/service x3 (activity).
jerna.notes: Also x2 earnings, reward (= zanseljerna or {nemjerna}), punishment/comeuppance (= {sfaseljerna}, {malseljerna}); x3 behavior; job (= {terjerna}); x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyjerna}, posyseljerna for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {jibri}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {canja}, {jdima}, {jinga}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {janta}, {kargu}, {vamji}.

jersi.definition: x1 chases/pursues/(physically) follows after x2; volition is not implied for x1 or x2.
jersi.notes: x1 follows after x2. See also {kavbu}, {rivbi}, {kalte}, {lidne}.

jerxo.definition: x1 reflects Algerian culture/nationality in aspect x2.

jesni.definition: x1 is a needle [pointed shape/form, not tool] of material x2.

jetce.definition: x1 is a jet [expelled stream] of material x2 expelled from x3.

jetnu.definition: x1 (du'u) is true/truth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics x2.
jetnu.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {stace}, {jitfa}, {fatci}, {birti}, {cfika}.

jgalu.definition: x1 is a/the claw/nail/talon [body-part] of x2; [metaphor: pointed, penetrating, physical weapon].

jganu.definition: x1 is an angle [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex x2 subtended by lateral [segment] x3.
